myMath

Class Polynom

  • java.lang.Object
    • myMath.Polynom
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    myMath.cont_function, myMath.function, myMath.Polynom_able

    public class Polynom
extends java.lang.Object
implements myMath.Polynom_able
    This class represents a Polynom with add, multiply functionality, it also should support the following: 1. Riemann's Integral: https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Riemann_integral 2. Finding a numerical value between two values (currently support root only f(x)=0). 3. Derivative
    Author:
    Boaz, Yosef Golubchik (209195353), Eli Haimov (308019306), Elad Cohen (307993030)

      Computes the Riemann sum of the current polynom between x0 and x1.

      Creates a copy of the current polynom.
      myMath.Polynom_able derivative()
      Creates a new polynom which is the derivative of the current polynom.
      void draw(double x0, double x1)
      Draws the graph of the polynom for x values from x0 to x1 Marks the Maximum and Minimum points on the graph Calculates the area above the polynom and below the x axis, and prints it to the console We used the opensource xchart library to draw the function https://github.com/knowm/XChart
      boolean equals(myMath.Polynom_able p1)
      Checks whether the current polynom is equal to a given polynom p1.
      double f(double x)
      gives value of polynom for a certain x value ex: polynom: 5x^2 + 3x + 2, f(3) = 5*3^2 + 3*3 + 2 = 56

      • equals

        public boolean equals(myMath.Polynom_able p1)
        Checks whether the current polynom is equal to a given polynom p1. Two polynoms are considered equal if their coefficients and powers are equal.
        Specified by:
        equals in interface myMath.Polynom_able

      • removeZero

        public void removeZero()

      • root

        public double root(double x0,
                   double x1,
                   double eps)
        This function uses the Bisection Method to find a root of the polynom between x0 and x1. https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Bisection_method
        Specified by:
        root in interface myMath.Polynom_able
        Parameters:
        x0 - The left boundary of the range.
        x1 - The right boundary of the range.
        eps - The maximum distance between x0 and x1 we will allow. The function will stop when x0 and x1 get at least this close.
        Returns:
        The x value of the root.

      • area

        public double area(double x0,
                   double x1,
                   double eps)
        Computes the Riemann sum of the current polynom between x0 and x1. https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Riemann_sum
        Specified by:
        area in interface myMath.cont_function
        Specified by:
        area in interface myMath.Polynom_able
        Parameters:
        x0 - The left boundary of the range.
        x1 - The right boundary of the range.
        eps - The width of one rectangle.
        Returns:
        The computed area value.

      • draw

        public void draw(double x0,
                 double x1)
        Draws the graph of the polynom for x values from x0 to x1 Marks the Maximum and Minimum points on the graph Calculates the area above the polynom and below the x axis, and prints it to the console We used the opensource xchart library to draw the function https://github.com/knowm/XChart
        Parameters:
        x0 - beginning of the drawing range
        x1 - ending of the drawing range
